at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

Dette dataelementet kan brukes pÃ¥ to forskjellige mÃ¥ter. For det fÃ¸rste kan eksklusjon av familiÃ¦r diabetes uttrykkes ved Ã¥ bruke runtime name constraint'en "FamiliÃ¦r sykdom", og "diabetes" som elementets verdi. Alternativt kan verdien vÃ¦re et prekoordinert uttrykk som "Ingen kjent diabetes i familien". Der det er mulig er det Ã¸nskelig Ã¥ kode verdien av "Ekskludert konsept" med en terminologi, enten med enkle eller prekoordinerte termer.

at0003.1.comment:
Dieses Item kann unterschiedlich genutzt werden. Zum Beispiel: "FamiliÃ¤re Vorgeschichte Diabetes":

(1) EinschrÃ¤nkung des Namens der "ausgeschlossenen Kategorie" zur Laufzeit Ã¼ber einen "Name constraint" (in diesem Fall "familiÃ¤re Probleme/Diagnosen") und Speicherung von "Diabetes" als Wert dieses Datenelements. 
oder
(2) Belegung des Wertes mit Hilfe von prÃ¤koordinierten Benennungen, z.B. "keine familiÃ¤re Diabetes-Vorgeschichte".

Die Kodierung des Datenelements "ausgeschlossene Kategorie", z.B. durch prÃ¤koordinierte Benennungen oder Terminologien, ist wÃ¼nschenswert.

Wird das Datenelement wie in Beispiel (2) kodiert, ist eine weitere Spezifikation im Feld "Aussage Ã¼ber den Ausschluss" nicht notwendig.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: Informatie over een enkele vast te stellen medische aandoening, een letsel, beperking of andere zaak die invloed heeft op de fysieke, mentale en/of het sociale welbevinden van een individu.
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0009.1.description: Verhalende beschrijving van het probleem of de diagnose.
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0000.1.description: *Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts  the physical, mental and/or social wellbeing of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0009.1.description: *Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

(1) EinschrÃ¤nkung des Namens der "ausgeschlossenen Kategorie" zur Laufzeit Ã¼ber einen "Name constraint" (in diesem Fall "familiÃ¤re Probleme/Diagnosen") und Speicherung von "Diabetes" als Wert dieses Datenelements.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.

at0000.1.description: *An instrument, apparatus, implant, material or similar, used in the provision of healthcare. In this context, a medical device includes a broad range of devices which act through a variety of physical, mechanical, thermal or similar means but specifically excludes devices which act through medicinal means such as pharmacological, metabolic or immunological methods.  The scope is inclusive of disposable devices as well as durable or persisting devices that require tracking, maintenance activities or regular calibration, recognising that each type of device has specific data recording requirements.(en)

at0000.1.description: *An instrument, apparatus, implant, material or similar, used in the provision of healthcare. In this context, a medical device includes a broad range of devices which act through a variety of physical, mechanical, thermal or similar means but specifically excludes devices which act through medicinal means such as pharmacological, metabolic or immunological methods.  The scope is inclusive of disposable devices as well as durable or persisting devices that require tracking, maintenance activities or regular calibration, recognising that each type of device has specific data recording requirements.(en)

A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.
at0003.1.comment:
Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.
